thread.title: Mesquite Horn QB and Oklahoma pledge Chris Robison 'going to be OK' after collision, could play this week
thread.title_full: Mesquite Horn QB and Oklahoma pledge Chris Robison 'going to be OK' after collision, could play this week | Dallas Morning News

author: Corbett Smith
title: Mesquite Horn QB and Oklahoma pledge Chris Robison 'going to be OK' after collision, could play this week
text:
Mesquite Horn junior quarterback Chris Robison did not break his leg after colliding with an electric fan on the sideline of Friday's 24-17 loss at Highland Park , according to Horn coach Mike Overton.
Robison, an Oklahoma pledge who has passed for 1,482 yards and 20 touchdowns, left the game in the second quarter after this play:
#Sooners 2017 QB commit Chris Robison hurt at Highland Park sideline #txhsfb @HornJagsRecruit pic.twitter.com/UbMZTNtCWU
â€” WFAA HS sports (@HSwfaa) October 10, 2015
Robison was helped off the field, taken to the locker room, and returned in the second half as a spectator, standing on the Horn sidelines with crutches and a protective boot .
Overton said that Robison "is going to be OK; there's no fracture or anything like that -- just going to be sore."
The coach added that if swelling stays in check, Robison might be able to play for Horn (3-3, 2-1 in 10-6A) this Friday against Richardson.
